Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale red pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is partially spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and remains of at least four lines of black-painted demotic text.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Cemeteries and Osireion Excavations Group
Bibliographic references: Frankfort 1933 / The Cenotaph of Seti I at Abydos (no.14,p.95)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.13)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393782) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393782)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 13 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
